TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PhoneStateListener extends Java.Lang.Object

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Runtime.Versioning.ObsoletedOSPlatform("android31.0", "This class is obsoleted in this android platform")]
[<System.Runtime.Versioning.ObsoletedOSPlatform("android31.0", "This class is obsoleted in this android platform")>]

Docs.summary: A listener class for monitoring changes in specific telephony states on the device, including service state, signal strength, message waiting indicator (voicemail), and others.

remarks.para: A listener class for monitoring changes in specific telephony states on the device, including service state, signal strength, message waiting indicator (voicemail), and others.

Override the methods for the state that you wish to receive updates for, and pass your PhoneStateListener object, along with bitwise-or of the LISTEN_ flags to TelephonyManager#listen TelephonyManager.listen(). Methods are called when the state changes, as well as once on initial registration.

Note that access to some telephony information is permission-protected. Your application won't receive updates for protected information unless it has the appropriate permissions declared in its manifest file. Where permissions apply, they are noted in the appropriate LISTEN_ flags.
This member is deprecated. Use TelephonyCallback instead.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Listen for Barring Information for the current registered / camped cell.

remarks.para: Listen for Barring Information for the current registered / camped cell.
Requires permission android.Manifest.permission#READ_PRECISE_PHONE_STATE or the calling app has carrier privileges (see TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges).
Also requires the Manifest.permission#ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION permission, regardless of whether the calling app has carrier privileges.
This member is deprecated. Use TelephonyCallback.BarringInfoListener instead.

Docs.summary: Listen for Registration Failures.

remarks.para:
Listen for Registration Failures.
Listen for indications that a registration procedure has failed in either the CS or PS domain. This indication does not necessarily indicate a change of service state, which should be tracked via #LISTEN_SERVICE_STATE.
Requires permission android.Manifest.permission#READ_PRECISE_PHONE_STATE or the calling app has carrier privileges (see TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges).
Also requires the Manifest.permission#ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION permission, regardless of whether the calling app has carrier privileges.
This member is deprecated. Use TelephonyCallback.RegistrationFailedListener instead.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Callback invoked when call disconnect cause changes on the registered subscription.

remarks.para: Callback invoked when call disconnect cause changes on the registered subscription. Note, the registration subId comes from TelephonyManager object which registers PhoneStateListener by TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int). If this TelephonyManager object was created with TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int), then the callback applies to the subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId().
This member is deprecated. Use TelephonyCallback.CallDisconnectCauseListener instead.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Sub OnCallStateChanged (state As CallState, phoneNumber As String)
public: virtual void OnCallStateChanged(Android::Telephony::CallState state, System::String ^ phoneNumber);
public virtual void OnCallStateChanged (Android.Telephony.CallState state, string? phoneNumber);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnCallStateChanged(valuetype Android.Telephony.CallState state, string phoneNumber) cil managed
abstract member OnCallStateChanged : Android.Telephony.CallState * string -> unit override this.OnCallStateChanged : Android.Telephony.CallState * string -> unit

Docs.param: call phone number. If application does not have android.Manifest.permission#READ_CALL_LOG READ_CALL_LOG permission or carrier privileges (see TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges), an empty string will be passed as an argument.
Docs.summary: Callback invoked when device call state changes.

remarks.para: Callback invoked when device call state changes.
Reports the state of Telephony (mobile) calls on the device for the registered subscription.

Note: the registration subId comes from TelephonyManager object which registers PhoneStateListener by TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int). If this TelephonyManager object was created with TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int), then the callback applies to the subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId().

Note: The state returned here may differ from that returned by TelephonyManager#getCallState(). Receivers of this callback should be aware that calling TelephonyManager#getCallState() from within this callback may return a different state than the callback reports.
Requires Permission: android.Manifest.permission#READ_PHONE_STATE READ_PHONE_STATE for applications targeting API level 31+.
This member is deprecated. Use TelephonyCallback.CallStateListener instead.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Sub OnEmergencyNumberListChanged (emergencyNumberList As IDictionary(Of Integer, IList(Of EmergencyNumber)))

public: virtual void OnEmergencyNumberListChanged(System::Collections::Generic::IDictionary<Java::Lang::Integer ^, System::Collections::Generic::IList<Android::Telephony::Emergency::EmergencyNumber ^> ^> ^ emergencyNumberList);

public virtual void OnEmergencyNumberListChanged (System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<Java.Lang.Integer,System.Collections.Generic.IList<Android.Telephony.Emergency.EmergencyNumber>> emergencyNumberList);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnEmergencyNumberListChanged(class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<class Java.Lang.Integer, class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Android.Telephony.Emergency.EmergencyNumber>> emergencyNumberList) cil managed

abstract member OnEmergencyNumberListChanged : System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<Java.Lang.Integer, System.Collections.Generic.IList<Android.Telephony.Emergency.EmergencyNumber>> -> unit override this.OnEmergencyNumberListChanged : System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<Java.Lang.Integer, System.Collections.Generic.IList<Android.Telephony.Emergency.EmergencyNumber>> -> unit

Docs.param: Map associating all active subscriptions on the device with the list of emergency numbers originating from that subscription. If there are no active subscriptions, the map will contain a single entry with SubscriptionManager#INVALID_SUBSCRIPTION_ID as the key and a list of emergency numbers as the value. If no emergency number information is available, the value will be null.
Docs.summary: Callback invoked when the current emergency number list has changed on the registered subscription.

remarks.para:
Callback invoked when the current emergency number list has changed on the registered subscription.
Note, the registered subscription is associated with TelephonyManager object on which TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int) was called. If this TelephonyManager object was created with TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int), then the callback applies to the given subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId().
This member is deprecated. Use TelephonyCallback.EmergencyNumberListListener instead.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Callback invoked when the message-waiting indicator changes on the registered subscription.

remarks.para: Callback invoked when the message-waiting indicator changes on the registered subscription. Note, the registration subId comes from TelephonyManager object which registers PhoneStateListener by TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int). If this TelephonyManager object was created with TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int), then the callback applies to the subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId().
This member is deprecated. Use TelephonyCallback.MessageWaitingIndicatorListener instead.

Docs.summary: Callback providing update about the default/internet data connection on the registered subscription.

remarks.para:
Callback providing update about the default/internet data connection on the registered subscription.
Note, the registration subId comes from TelephonyManager object which registers PhoneStateListener by TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int). If this TelephonyManager object was created with TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int), then the callback applies to the subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId().
Requires permission android.Manifest.permission#READ_PRECISE_PHONE_STATE or the calling app has carrier privileges (see TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges).
This member is deprecated. Use TelephonyCallback.PreciseDataConnectionStateListener instead.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Sub OnRegistrationFailed (cellIdentity As CellIdentity, chosenPlmn As String, domain As Integer, causeCode As Integer, additionalCauseCode As Integer)
public: virtual void OnRegistrationFailed(Android::Telephony::CellIdentity ^ cellIdentity, System::String ^ chosenPlmn, int domain, int causeCode, int additionalCauseCode);
public virtual void OnRegistrationFailed (Android.Telephony.CellIdentity cellIdentity, string chosenPlmn, int domain, int causeCode, int additionalCauseCode);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnRegistrationFailed(class Android.Telephony.CellIdentity cellIdentity, string chosenPlmn, int32 domain, int32 causeCode, int32 additionalCauseCode) cil managed

abstract member OnRegistrationFailed : Android.Telephony.CellIdentity * string * int * int * int -> unit override this.OnRegistrationFailed : Android.Telephony.CellIdentity * string * int * int * int -> unit

Docs.param: the CellIdentity, which must include the globally unique identifier for the cell (for example, all components of the CGI or ECGI).
a 5 or 6 digit alphanumeric PLMN (MCC|MNC) among those broadcast by the cell that was chosen for the failed registration attempt.
DOMAIN_CS, DOMAIN_PS or both in case of a combined procedure.

the primary failure cause code of the procedure. For GSM/UMTS (MM), values are in TS 24.008 Sec 10.5.95 For GSM/UMTS (GMM), values are in TS 24.008 Sec 10.5.147 For LTE (EMM), cause codes are TS 24.301 Sec 9.9.3.9 For NR (5GMM), cause codes are TS 24.501 Sec 9.11.3.2 Integer.MAX_VALUE if this value is unused.

the cause code of any secondary/combined procedure if appropriate. For UMTS, if a combined attach succeeds for PS only, then the GMM cause code shall be included as an additionalCauseCode. For LTE (ESM), cause codes are in TS 24.301 9.9.4.4. Integer.MAX_VALUE if this value is unused.
Docs.summary: Report that Registration or a Location/Routing/Tracking Area update has failed.

remarks.para: Report that Registration or a Location/Routing/Tracking Area update has failed.

Indicate whenever a registration procedure, including a location, routing, or tracking area update fails. This includes procedures that do not necessarily result in a change of the modem's registration status. If the modem's registration status changes, that is reflected in the onNetworkStateChanged() and subsequent get{Voice/Data}RegistrationState().
Because registration failures are ephemeral, this callback is not sticky. Registrants will not receive the most recent past value when registering.
This member is deprecated. Use TelephonyCallback.RegistrationFailedListener instead.

format.a: Java documentation for android.telephony.PhoneStateListener.onRegistrationFailed(android.telephony.CellIdentity, java.lang.String, int, int, int).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Sub OnServiceStateChanged (serviceState As ServiceState)
public: virtual void OnServiceStateChanged(Android::Telephony::ServiceState ^ serviceState);
public virtual void OnServiceStateChanged (Android.Telephony.ServiceState? serviceState);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnServiceStateChanged(class Android.Telephony.ServiceState serviceState) cil managed
abstract member OnServiceStateChanged : Android.Telephony.ServiceState -> unit override this.OnServiceStateChanged : Android.Telephony.ServiceState -> unit

Docs.summary: Callback invoked when device service state changes on the registered subscription.

remarks.para:
Callback invoked when device service state changes on the registered subscription. Note, the registration subId comes from TelephonyManager object which registers PhoneStateListener by TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int). If this TelephonyManager object was created with TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int), then the callback applies to the subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId().
The instance of ServiceState passed as an argument here will have various levels of location information stripped from it depending on the location permissions that your app holds. Only apps holding the Manifest.permission#ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION permission will receive all the information in ServiceState, otherwise the cellIdentity will be null if apps only holding the Manifest.permission#ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION permission. Network operator name in long/short alphanumeric format and numeric id will be null if apps holding neither android.Manifest.permission#ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION nor android.Manifest.permission#ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION.
This member is deprecated. Use TelephonyCallback.ServiceStateListener instead.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
